learning_outcomes.description: Identify a research topic within the field of English Literature.
Plan and carry out research within the field of English Literature.
Access, evaluate and critique primary and secondary sources.
Develop an argument critically and clearly.

assessments.due_date:
24/10/2025 4:00 pm

Submit 2 x bound thesis copies to School Office + upload one virtual copy via TurnItIn.
assessments.task_description:
Students workÂ in conjunction with a Supervisor to research and present a 15,000 word dissertation.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Two bound copies of your thesis are to be submitted to the School of Communication and Arts Office, 6th Floor, Michie Building. An electronic version also needs to be uploaded via Turnitin. For further submission information, please refer to the School of Communication and Arts honours webpage.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 25(24 Feb - 26 Oct)
